arm_group.description:
montelukast sodium
dosage
< 1000g : 0.5 mg/D QD
1000g~1500g : 1.0 mg/D QD
1500g~2000g : 1.5 mg/D QD
> 2000g : 2mg/D QD
medication period : to discharge or GA 36wks
Standard treatment of BPD and preterm infants

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is multicentered, prospective, randomized, opened, parallel, intervention study.

      The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Montelukast sodium in the
      prevention of bronchopulmonary dysplasia (BPD) in preterm infant, below 32weeks gestational
      age.

      The investigators evaluate the first effectiveness through the morbidity and mortality of
      bronchopulmonary dysplasia. And then, the investigators evaluate the second effectiveness
      through the oxygen index, the usage of mechanical ventilator about taking medicine after 2
      Weeks, Oxygen Utilization After 4 Weeks, Proinflammatory Cytokine through the bronchial
      lavage fluid.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Montelukast Sodium in the Prevention of Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Preterm infants born at less than 32 weeks

          -  Birth 14 days after, oxygen or artificial ventilation who are using patient

          -  more than 20cal/kg/d by enteral feeding

          -  written consent of the parents

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  congenital anomaly

          -  cardiovascular collapse

          -  investigator's opinion

intervention.description: a leukotriene D4 receptor antagonist; sodium salt is the active compound; structure in first source

clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Montelukast Sodium in the Prevention of Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia

primary_outcome.description: At corrected gestational age 36 weeks, to compare the incidence of moderate to severe BPD or mortality
primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of moderate to severe BPD or mortality

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygen Index. Use of mechanical ventilation, oxygen, systemic steroid. Weight gain, adverse event

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
